docs.title: Direct Connect
docs.text:
If a server is set to private and doesn't show up in the server browser, you can directly connect to it from the console by:

  1. Opening the console.
  2. Typing in connect <ip address>:<port number>. The default port is 37015.

If you are using a normal Titanfall 2 client (Note this will only work on servers with ns_auth_allow_insecure 1):

  1. Open Origin, click on Titanfall 2 and Click on the settings icon.
  2. Click Game Properties and select Advanced Launch Options.
  3. Add +bind "KEY" "connect <ip address>:<port>"
  4. Open the game and select a single player level e.g The Gauntlet
  5. Press the KEY you specified in step 3

docs.title: Gamemodes
docs.text:
Northstar comes included with some community made gamemodes.

Info

If you are looking for every available gamemode and its corresponding string check hosting/gamemodes

docs.title: Gun Game
docs.text: Get a kill with each gun to win.

docs.title: Titan Tag
docs.text: Earn points while in your titan. Destroy a titan to get your own.

docs.title: Infection
docs.text: Survivors are infected when killed.

docs.title: Amped Killrace
docs.text: Get kills to increase the length of your killrace. Collect the flag to start it. Set the record to win.

docs.title: Fastball
docs.text: Hack control panels to win rounds and respawn your teammates.

docs.title: Competitive CTF
docs.text: CTF with custom settings for Comp games.

docs.title: Frontier War
docs.text: Kill enemies to earn your titan, and use it to destroy the enemies Harvester.

docs.title: Riffs
docs.text: Northstar also comes with several gameplay modifiers called riffs that can be toggled on and off by server hosts, or used in a private match.

docs.title: Deadly Ground
docs.text: Creates a layer of electric smoke on the lowest parts of the map (does not cover the entire map)

docs.title: Great Bamboozle
docs.text: Everyone's kit is changed to Holo Pilot.

docs.title: Attack on Titanfall
docs.text: Everyone's kit is changed to Grapple, and Grapple gains one extra use.

docs.title: Otherside
docs.text: Everyone's kit is changed to Phase Shift.

docs.title: Spicy
docs.text: Replaces all ordnance/grenades with ticks.

docs.title: Tactikill
docs.text: Killing an enemy refreshes your tactical/pilot kit.

docs.title: Amped Tacticals
docs.text: Every tactical/pilot kit gets an additional use to it

docs.title: Rocket Arena
docs.text: Weapons are replaced with an EPG that does 40 damage, a RE-45 that does reduced damage, and a Charge Rifle

docs.title: Armed & Dangerous
docs.text: Weapons are replaced with a Kraber, Mastiff, and Charge Rifle

docs.title: Iron Rules
docs.text: Disables disembarking and ejecting from titans.

docs.title: First person embarks/executions
docs.text: Enables first person embark animations for titans and first person executions for both pilots and titans.

docs.title: Instagib
docs.text: Every kill gibs

docs.title: Launch arguments
docs.text:
Here's a list of new command line arguments that Northstar introduces, they should be included in ns_startup_args.txt or ns_startup_args_dedi.txt.

Argument Description Value -disablelogs Disable logging and creation of log files -nonorthstardll Disables Northstar loading -northstar Enables Northstar loading -vanilla Enables vanilla compatibility -dedicated Starts a dedicated server without video output -waitfordebugger Waits for debugger to connect before launching game -language Forces loading of client localisation language string ex: portuguese -profile= Enabled specifying a different profile directory. Default: R2Northstar Example: -profile="dev mods" -enablechathooks Enables the use of chathooks for use by mods -noplugins Disables the plugin system

Here's a list of command line arguments from the base game.

Argument Description Value -novid Disables startup videos -nosound Disables all game sounds

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text: Variable name Description Value LFX Enables the use of LatencyFleX (Linux-only) 0 or 1

docs.title: Pre-installed mods
docs.text:
Northstar by default comes with 3 mods installed. They are located in the Titanfall2\R2Northstar\mods folder. You can access these from the Mods menu at the bottom of the main menu.

  • Northstar.Client - Various ui and client changes to fix bugs and add better support for mods
  • Northstar.Custom - Additional gamemodes and weapons for the game, such as Fastball, Titan Tag, Infection, and Hide and Seek.
  • Northstar.CustomServers - The basic mod for hosting servers with additional match settings

docs.title: Community created mods
docs.text:
Northstar additionally has many mods that are created by members of the community which are avaliable on the Northstar Discord. They can be found in the following channels:

  • #northstar-client-mods for client-side only mods like HUD changes, skins, etc.
  • #northstar-server-mods for mods that primarily target servers, like new gamemodes, moderation tools, etc.

docs.title: Thunderstore
docs.text: Northstar also has a Thunderstore page! You can find lots of mods here too! These mods are packaged slightly differently, and therefore have a different install proccess. In each .zip you download from Thunderstore, there will, at minimum be 2 files, icon.png and manifest.json. You can ignore or delete those. There will also be a folder called mods and in said folder the mod itself. Move the contents of the mods folder into R2Northstar\mods and you should be good!

docs.title: Packages
docs.text: Packages are community created mods with the Thunderstore package structure retained used for installation via Mod Managers. They are located in the Titanfall2\R2Northstar\packages folder and can be accessed via the Mods menu at the bottom of the main menu.

docs.title: Manual installation
docs.text:
1. Download a mod from Thunderstore
  2. Right click the relevant Zip and Extract All \ (Keep the suggested destination folder)
  3. Copy the output folder into Titanfall2\R2Northstar\packages

docs.title: Progression
docs.text: As of version 1.19.0 Northstar allows you to toggle the progression system. This means that you can choose whether to have everything unlocked or not. By default progression is disabled and all weapons and skins are unlocked.

docs.title: Enabling/Disabling Progression
docs.text:
1. Go into the multiplayer lobby
  2. Click on the "Toggle Progression" button at the bottom of the screen
  3. Click "Yes" to toggle progression

docs.title: Server Browser
docs.text:
Northstar Comes with a server browser which you can use to connect to community hosted servers. Hovering over a server name will show you what mods the server has enabled and the version of those mods. Each server can be connected to by clicking on its name. You can refresh the list of servers by clicking the Refresh button in the bottom corner.

The search bar can be used to filter servers by name, map or gamemode.

docs.title: Playing vanilla Titanfall 2 via Northstar
docs.text: While Northstar comes pre-packaged with mods to support community servers and custom content, some users may not want all of this. Northstar can also be used to load mods on vanilla more easily and with more stability than vpk modding, and can sometimes help when the game doesn't want to launch at all.

docs.title: Launching vanilla Titanfall 2 via Northstar (no mods)
docs.text:
This method of launching Titanfall 2 is generally done when some part of Steam/EA launching Titanfall 2 doesn't work properly. You can do this by going to your Titanfall2 directory, creating a Vanilla.bat file, right clicking the Vanilla.bat file, hitting Edit, then entering NorthstarLauncher.exe -nonorthstardll.

Once you do this, double click the Vanilla.bat file to load vanilla Titanfall 2 via Northstar without mods.

docs.title: Launching vanilla Titanfall 2 via Northstar (with mods)
docs.text:
While Northstar is seeing more progress towards vanilla compatibility, it's still decently far out. A community made modification is available in the form of VanillaPlus to load mods on vanilla. It should be noted that, again, this is a community made modification and is not "officially" Northstar.

To use it, read the mod's description on Thunderstore to install it, as it has a special install process compared to other mods. If you have any issues, check the VanillaPlus FAQ to see if you can find your issue there. If you can't find your issue on the FAQ, open an issue on the mod's GitHub repo.
